title: 21+ Fonts Similar to Gotham (2025) Fresh Alternatives
description: Are you on the lookout for all of the best fonts similar to Gotham? If you are, then you've come to the best place! Here, are top Gotham font alternatives.
author: Jacob Cass
excerpt: Are you on the lookout for all of the best fonts similar to Gotham? If you are, then you've come to the best place! Here, are top Gotham font alternatives.
text: Are you on the lookout for fonts similar to Gotham? If you are, then you’ve come to the right place! We’re jotting down all of the Gotham font alternatives! One of the better-known typefaces of the early 21st century is Gotham. Produced after Frere-Jones did a thorough study of the vernacular lettering in New York City, it’s since become a crowd favorite across users of all demographics and backgrounds. Here’s a fun fact: the lettering on the Port Authority Bus Terminal sign in Manhattan served as the initial source of inspiration for the design. The letterforms of this geometric sans-serif typeface family, which was created by American type designer Tobias Frere-Jones and Jesse Ragan and released by the Hoefler & Frere-Jones foundry in 2000, were influenced by mid-century architectural signs. Gotham Font. Image credit: MyFonts Gotham’s design is fairly broad, with moderately high x-height and wide apertures. Having said that, this selection is usually used by people who want fonts that are clean and designed for headlines. FONTS SIMILAR TO GOTHAM – UNLIMITED DOWNLOADS: 50 Million+ Fonts & Design Assets Image credit: Envato Elements Download all the fonts similar to Gotham you need and many other design elements, available for a monthly subscription by subscribing to Envato Elements. The subscription costs $16.50 per month and gives you unlimited access to a massive and growing library of over 50 million items that can be downloaded as often as you need (stock effect & element packs too)! 20+ Gotham Alternatives 1. HAMLIN – Minimal Geometric Typeface + Web Fonts image credit: Envato Elements HAMLIN stands distinctively from other sans-serif fonts due to its minimal and geometric design. The font features a combination of straight lines, sleek curves, and sharp angles, creating a clean and modern look. Unlike other fonts that may have more elaborate designs or decorative elements, HAMLIN focuses on simplicity, making it well-suited for use in projects that require a clean and minimal look, such as branding, marketing outreach materials, and text body for blogs and social media posts. 2. JUST Sans®Modern and clean minimalist geometric typeface Gotham alternative, JUST Sans. Image credit: Envato ElementsJUST Sans® Modern and clean minimalist geometric typeface  stands out when used because of its clean, elegant, expressive, and modern design. The font features simple, open-airy characters and a generous width making it easy to read even in smaller text sizes making it a great Gotham alternative. The minimal design of the font makes it well-suited for projects that require a clean, simple, minimal, and modern aesthetic, such as branding, marketing materials, and digital content. Grab two free weights here. 3. Moss image credit: Envato Elements A sans-serif font with a clean and modern design, the Moss font family features a balanced structure and consistent spacing, making it easy to read in smaller sizes. The font family includes multiple weights and styles, giving you freedom and variation in typography design. Mosse font is suitable for use in a wide range of projects, including branding, marketing materials, and digital content. 4. Quick – Simple Sans Serif Family Font image credit: Envato Elements Quick – Simple Sans Serif Family Font is a typeface with a minimalistic and straightforward design. It features a clean structure with uniform width and consistent spacing, making it easy to read at smaller sizes. The font family includes multiple weights and styles to allow you to experiment with typography designs using the typeface. Quick is ideal for use in projects that require a modern, neutral, and functional look, such as branding, marketing materials, text bodies, newsletters, and email marketing. 5. Shield image credit: Envato Elements A modern decorative sans serif font, Shield offers unique font that features circular shapes, elegant curves, and distinctive styles. The font has a strong, bold, and impactful feel, Shield is well-suited for use in projects that require a striking and eye-catching look, such as logos, titles, and headlines. Shield font also includes various alternates and ligatures to offer endless possibilities with your project’s looks. 6. Hyang Modern Sans Serif Font image credit: Envato Elements Hyang Modern Sans Serif Font is characterized by a clean, modern, and simple design. It features balanced proportions and a consistent structure, making it easy to read in smaller sizes. With its sleek and slender lines and curves, Hyang Modern Sans Serif Font is well-suited for use in projects that require a neutral look, such as textbooks, quotes, branding products, and book covers. Of course, this also makes it perfect for a text overlay that fits any background image or formal and semi-formal text. 7. Essentials – Sans Serif Font image credit: Envato Elements Essentials – Sans Serif Font is a font with a clean and functional design. This modern and formal typeface features characters that seem to dance along the baseline. This is perfect for your most creative ideas like movie and book titles, posters, quotes, cards and invitations, and many more. The pack comes in OTF, TTF, and WOFF. 8. Megat – Modern Geometric Font image credit: Envato Elements Megat – Modern Geometric Font is different from other sans-serif fonts due to its unique and distinctive geometric design. Unlike other sans-serif fonts that typically have a more neutral and straightforward design, Megat features bold shapes and angles, giving it a modern and eye-catching look. The font is inspired by geometric shapes and features a consistent structure, making it easy to read at smaller sizes yet remaining unique. It is well-suited for use in projects that require a contemporary and impactful look, such as logos, titles, and headlines. 9. Kedal – Geometric Font image credit: Envato Elements Another geometric sans serif font is Kedal – Geometric Font. The font features a combination of straight lines, bold curves, and angles, creating a distinctive and modern look. Unlike other sans-serif fonts that typically have a more neutral and simple design, Kedal stands out with its bold geometric shapes in all lowercase. The font is well-suited for use in projects that require a contemporary and impactful look, such as logos, titles, albums and book covers, and product labels. 10. Meticula – Sans-serif Typeface image credit: Creative Market A family of 18 fonts, the Meticula – Sans-serif Typeface is unique from other sans-serif fonts because it combines simplicity and elegance. The font features a clean and modern design, combining meticulous geometric shapes and modern sans serif typefaces. With its simplicity with a touch of elegance, it is well-suited for use in projects that require a clean and refined look, such as logos, product labels and packaging, headlines and body texts, and many endless uses. 11. Chronica Pro Family (18 fonts) image credit: Creative Market Chronica Pro Family is one of the most useful sans serif fonts due to its versatility and functionality. The font family includes 18 different fonts, providing a wide range of options for typography design in various projects. It brags a new contemporary look focused on balance and quality for high professional use. Chronica Pro could satisfy all kinds of demands such as editorial design, brand creation, graphic design, and signage as well as on-screen, apps, websites, e-books, etc. 12. BN Bergen image credit: Creative Market BN Bergen is a sans-serif font with a modern and distinctive design. The font features rounded edges and curved lines, giving it a soft and friendly appearance. Unlike other sans-serif fonts that have straightforward or neutral designs, BN Bergen has a unique and playful look, making it well-suited for projects that require a more relaxed and approachable style, like branding for casual or lifestyle brands. The font’s design is both functional and aesthetically pleasing, making it a great choice for a wide range of design projects that require a modern and playful look. 13. Phoenix – A Multi-Weight Sans image credit: Creative Market Phoenix is a bold and timeless sans-serif font family, blending classic elegance with modern sophistication. With clean lines and a sleek design, Phoenix offers a versatile and polished look, making it suitable for a wide range of design projects. Its 6 weights, available in both Regular and Italic, transition seamlessly from Light to Extra Bold, providing flexibility for everything from headlines to body text. Phoenix’s smooth curves and thoughtful details add a human touch, perfect for logos, quotes, and professional designs. 14. Oakes Grotesk – Full Family image credit: Creative Market Oakes Grotesk is a versatile and stylish sans-serif font that offers a full family pack, making it a great choice for all your design needs. It provides a lot of customization options, allowing you to create a unique and cohesive look for your brand. The full family pack includes 10 font styles including the italics versions, ensuring that you will have the perfect style for every project. Investing in Oakes Grotesk is a great decision for anyone looking for a versatile and stylish font that will make their designs stand out. 15. Hank Rounded The Hank Rounded font family pack is a great investment for anyone looking for a rounded sans-serif font with a modern and playful feel. The font features rounded edges, giving it a softer and more approachable look, making it perfect for projects that require a friendly and inviting design. The pack comes in four weights allowing you to create a unique and cohesive look for your design, from logo, labels, headlines, and even text body. Hank Rounded is a great decision for anyone looking for a rounded sans-serif font that will add a touch of personality and playfulness to their designs. 16. Strima image credit: MyFonts With over 1000 glyphs and extensive language support, Strima offers full professional typographic features. The Strima family consists of 4 weights: light, book, medium, and bold. The font’s design is both functional and aesthetically pleasing, making it a great choice for projects that require a minimalist and modern look. The clean and modern design of Strima makes it a good choice for any project that needs a sophisticated and professional look. 17. Gordita image credit: MyFonts Gordita font can make your designs better by adding a playful and quirky touch. The design is unique and eye-catching, making it ideal for projects that require a bold and attention-grabbing look. The font’s playful and distinctive style can help bring personality and character to your designs, making them stand out from the crowd. Whether you’re working on a fun and lighthearted project or simply want to add a touch of playfulness to your designs, Gordita font is a great choice that can help make your designs better. 18. Clear Sans® Text image credit: MyFonts Clear Sans® Text font can elevate your designs and projects by adding a clean and modern look. The font features simple, uncluttered lines and a balanced structure, making it easy to read and suitable for a wide range of projects, from digital interfaces to print materials. It is designed to be highly legible on screen, making it an excellent choice for digital projects. The font’s minimalist design allows for a more focused and professional look, making it ideal for projects that require a clean and sophisticated feel. 19. Flink Neue image credit: MyFonts A geometric font with sleek lines, Flink Neue can improve the look of your designs by adding a touch of playfulness and personality. This font family is a comprehensive collection that includes 18 different weights, ranging from thin to black, each with its own matching italic version. The font includes almost 1400 characters per style, providing a range of typographical options. To add to its versatility, Flink Neue also includes nine stylistic sets, which offer a wide array of variations to the overall look and feel of the font, allowing you to create truly unique and custom designs. 20. Central image credit: MyFonts The Central font was created with a specific purpose in mind, to serve as the main font for theater-hub websites. Its simple geometric shapes and refined design offer a visually appealing contrast when used in small font sizes on screens. This makes Central an excellent choice for use in digital text applications, particularly when used as a titling font. 21. AIRSPACE – Minimal Sans Serif Font image credit: Creative Market Airspace is a sleek and modern sans-serif font, featuring clean lines and an elegant design that ensures readability across various applications. With support for both Roman and Cyrillic characters, Airspace offers versatility and adaptability, making it suitable for global design needs. The uppercase alphabet, numbers, and symbols are crafted with precision, delivering a polished and professional look. Ideal for magazine layouts, logos, invitations, and digital artwork, Airspace’s balanced structure and contemporary style make it a go-to choice for a wide range of creative projects. 22. Exensa Grotesk Typeface + Web Fonts image credit: Creative Market Exensa Grotesk is a refined sans-serif typeface inspired by Swiss Design, offering a clean and expressive aesthetic. With its uniform structure and balanced spacing, Exensa Grotesk ensures excellent readability for both headlines and body text. The font family includes 5 weights (Light, Regular, Bold, Extra Bold, Black) and their italic counterparts, providing ample versatility for creative typography. Perfect for projects requiring a modern and elegant touch, Exensa Grotesk is ideal for branding, editorial content, and digital designs. The typeface includes extended language support, 303 glyphs, and improved kerning, making it a reliable and professional choice for your next project. Free Fonts Similar to Gotham:  If you’re looking for a free font similar to Gotham, check out Montserrat available on Google Fonts. This is our pick for the best free Gotham alternative and it is used on featured on more than 16,000,000 websites. Related Content: Fonts Similar to Impact Fonts Similar to Helvetica Monospace Fonts for Coding 20+ Fonts Similar to Gotham (2025) Summary All in all, the best fonts similar to Gotham are all amazing finds, each designed to provide you with clean-looking and professional sans serifs for a variety of designs and projects. Whether you’re working on a client document or a creative magazine headline, we hope our roundup of the top picks in the category helps you narrow your search and makes you a more efficient storyteller. What’s your favorite font bundle on the list? Let us know in the comment section!
html:
Are you on the lookout for fonts similar to Gotham? If you are, then you’ve come to the right place!

We’re jotting down all of the Gotham font alternatives!

One of the better-known typefaces of the early 21st century is Gotham. Produced after Frere-Jones did a thorough study of the vernacular lettering in New York City, it’s since become a crowd favorite across users of all demographics and backgrounds.

Here’s a fun fact: the lettering on the Port Authority Bus Terminal sign in Manhattan served as the initial source of inspiration for the design.

The letterforms of this geometric sans-serif typeface family, which was created by American type designer Tobias Frere-Jones and Jesse Ragan and released by the Hoefler & Frere-Jones foundry in 2000, were influenced by mid-century architectural signs.

Gotham’s design is fairly broad, with moderately high x-height and wide apertures. Having said that, this selection is usually used by people who want fonts that are clean and designed for headlines.

FONTS SIMILAR TO GOTHAM – UNLIMITED DOWNLOADS: 50 Million+ Fonts & Design Assets

Download all the fonts similar to Gotham you need and many other design elements, available for a monthly subscription by subscribing to Envato Elements. The subscription costs $16.50 per month and gives you unlimited access to a massive and growing library of over 50 million items that can be downloaded as often as you need (stock effect & element packs too)!

20+ Gotham Alternatives

1. HAMLIN – Minimal Geometric Typeface + Web Fonts

HAMLIN stands distinctively from other sans-serif fonts due to its minimal and geometric design. The font features a combination of straight lines, sleek curves, and sharp angles, creating a clean and modern look.

Unlike other fonts that may have more elaborate designs or decorative elements, HAMLIN focuses on simplicity, making it well-suited for use in projects that require a clean and minimal look, such as branding, marketing outreach materials, and text body for blogs and social media posts.

2. JUST Sans®Modern and clean minimalist geometric typeface

Gotham alternative, JUST Sans. Image credit: Envato ElementsJUST Sans® Modern and clean minimalist geometric typeface  stands out when used because of its clean, elegant, expressive, and modern design.

The font features simple, open-airy characters and a generous width making it easy to read even in smaller text sizes making it a great Gotham alternative.

The minimal design of the font makes it well-suited for projects that require a clean, simple, minimal, and modern aesthetic, such as branding, marketing materials, and digital content. Grab two free weights here.

3. Moss

A sans-serif font with a clean and modern design, the Moss font family features a balanced structure and consistent spacing, making it easy to read in smaller sizes.

The font family includes multiple weights and styles, giving you freedom and variation in typography design. Mosse font is suitable for use in a wide range of projects, including branding, marketing materials, and digital content.

4. Quick – Simple Sans Serif Family Font

Quick – Simple Sans Serif Family Font is a typeface with a minimalistic and straightforward design.

It features a clean structure with uniform width and consistent spacing, making it easy to read at smaller sizes. The font family includes multiple weights and styles to allow you to experiment with typography designs using the typeface.

Quick is ideal for use in projects that require a modern, neutral, and functional look, such as branding, marketing materials, text bodies, newsletters, and email marketing.

5. Shield

A modern decorative sans serif font, Shield offers unique font that features circular shapes, elegant curves, and distinctive styles.

The font has a strong, bold, and impactful feel, Shield is well-suited for use in projects that require a striking and eye-catching look, such as logos, titles, and headlines.

Shield font also includes various alternates and ligatures to offer endless possibilities with your project’s looks.

6. Hyang Modern Sans Serif Font

Hyang Modern Sans Serif Font is characterized by a clean, modern, and simple design. It features balanced proportions and a consistent structure, making it easy to read in smaller sizes.

With its sleek and slender lines and curves, Hyang Modern Sans Serif Font is well-suited for use in projects that require a neutral look, such as textbooks, quotes, branding products, and book covers.

Of course, this also makes it perfect for a text overlay that fits any background image or formal and semi-formal text.

7. Essentials – Sans Serif Font

Essentials – Sans Serif Font is a font with a clean and functional design. This modern and formal typeface features characters that seem to dance along the baseline. This is perfect for your most creative ideas like movie and book titles, posters, quotes, cards and invitations, and many more. The pack comes in OTF, TTF, and WOFF.

8. Megat – Modern Geometric Font

Megat – Modern Geometric Font is different from other sans-serif fonts due to its unique and distinctive geometric design. Unlike other sans-serif fonts that typically have a more neutral and straightforward design, Megat features bold shapes and angles, giving it a modern and eye-catching look.

The font is inspired by geometric shapes and features a consistent structure, making it easy to read at smaller sizes yet remaining unique. It is well-suited for use in projects that require a contemporary and impactful look, such as logos, titles, and headlines.

9. Kedal – Geometric Font

Another geometric sans serif font is Kedal – Geometric Font. The font features a combination of straight lines, bold curves, and angles, creating a distinctive and modern look.

Unlike other sans-serif fonts that typically have a more neutral and simple design, Kedal stands out with its bold geometric shapes in all lowercase.

The font is well-suited for use in projects that require a contemporary and impactful look, such as logos, titles, albums and book covers, and product labels.

10. Meticula – Sans-serif Typeface

A family of 18 fonts, the Meticula – Sans-serif Typeface is unique from other sans-serif fonts because it combines simplicity and elegance.

The font features a clean and modern design, combining meticulous geometric shapes and modern sans serif typefaces.

With its simplicity with a touch of elegance, it is well-suited for use in projects that require a clean and refined look, such as logos, product labels and packaging, headlines and body texts, and many endless uses.

11. Chronica Pro Family (18 fonts)

Chronica Pro Family is one of the most useful sans serif fonts due to its versatility and functionality.

The font family includes 18 different fonts, providing a wide range of options for typography design in various projects. It brags a new contemporary look focused on balance and quality for high professional use.

Chronica Pro could satisfy all kinds of demands such as editorial design, brand creation, graphic design, and signage as well as on-screen, apps, websites, e-books, etc.

12. BN Bergen

BN Bergen is a sans-serif font with a modern and distinctive design. The font features rounded edges and curved lines, giving it a soft and friendly appearance.

Unlike other sans-serif fonts that have straightforward or neutral designs, BN Bergen has a unique and playful look, making it well-suited for projects that require a more relaxed and approachable style, like branding for casual or lifestyle brands.

The font’s design is both functional and aesthetically pleasing, making it a great choice for a wide range of design projects that require a modern and playful look.

13. Phoenix – A Multi-Weight Sans

Phoenix is a bold and timeless sans-serif font family, blending classic elegance with modern sophistication.

With clean lines and a sleek design, Phoenix offers a versatile and polished look, making it suitable for a wide range of design projects.

Its 6 weights, available in both Regular and Italic, transition seamlessly from Light to Extra Bold, providing flexibility for everything from headlines to body text. Phoenix’s smooth curves and thoughtful details add a human touch, perfect for logos, quotes, and professional designs.

14. Oakes Grotesk – Full Family

Oakes Grotesk is a versatile and stylish sans-serif font that offers a full family pack, making it a great choice for all your design needs.

It provides a lot of customization options, allowing you to create a unique and cohesive look for your brand.

The full family pack includes 10 font styles including the italics versions, ensuring that you will have the perfect style for every project.

Investing in Oakes Grotesk is a great decision for anyone looking for a versatile and stylish font that will make their designs stand out.

15. Hank Rounded

The Hank Rounded font family pack is a great investment for anyone looking for a rounded sans-serif font with a modern and playful feel.

The font features rounded edges, giving it a softer and more approachable look, making it perfect for projects that require a friendly and inviting design.

The pack comes in four weights allowing you to create a unique and cohesive look for your design, from logo, labels, headlines, and even text body.

Hank Rounded is a great decision for anyone looking for a rounded sans-serif font that will add a touch of personality and playfulness to their designs.

16. Strima

With over 1000 glyphs and extensive language support, Strima offers full professional typographic features.

The Strima family consists of 4 weights: light, book, medium, and bold. The font’s design is both functional and aesthetically pleasing, making it a great choice for projects that require a minimalist and modern look.

The clean and modern design of Strima makes it a good choice for any project that needs a sophisticated and professional look.

17. Gordita

Gordita font can make your designs better by adding a playful and quirky touch. The design is unique and eye-catching, making it ideal for projects that require a bold and attention-grabbing look.

The font’s playful and distinctive style can help bring personality and character to your designs, making them stand out from the crowd.

Whether you’re working on a fun and lighthearted project or simply want to add a touch of playfulness to your designs, Gordita font is a great choice that can help make your designs better.

18. Clear Sans® Text

Clear Sans® Text font can elevate your designs and projects by adding a clean and modern look.

The font features simple, uncluttered lines and a balanced structure, making it easy to read and suitable for a wide range of projects, from digital interfaces to print materials.

It is designed to be highly legible on screen, making it an excellent choice for digital projects.

The font’s minimalist design allows for a more focused and professional look, making it ideal for projects that require a clean and sophisticated feel.

19. Flink Neue

A geometric font with sleek lines, Flink Neue can improve the look of your designs by adding a touch of playfulness and personality.

This font family is a comprehensive collection that includes 18 different weights, ranging from thin to black, each with its own matching italic version.

The font includes almost 1400 characters per style, providing a range of typographical options.

To add to its versatility, Flink Neue also includes nine stylistic sets, which offer a wide array of variations to the overall look and feel of the font, allowing you to create truly unique and custom designs.

20. Central

The Central font was created with a specific purpose in mind, to serve as the main font for theater-hub websites.

Its simple geometric shapes and refined design offer a visually appealing contrast when used in small font sizes on screens.

This makes Central an excellent choice for use in digital text applications, particularly when used as a titling font.

21. AIRSPACE – Minimal Sans Serif Font

Airspace is a sleek and modern sans-serif font, featuring clean lines and an elegant design that ensures readability across various applications.

With support for both Roman and Cyrillic characters, Airspace offers versatility and adaptability, making it suitable for global design needs. The uppercase alphabet, numbers, and symbols are crafted with precision, delivering a polished and professional look.

Ideal for magazine layouts, logos, invitations, and digital artwork, Airspace’s balanced structure and contemporary style make it a go-to choice for a wide range of creative projects.

22. Exensa Grotesk Typeface + Web Fonts

Exensa Grotesk is a refined sans-serif typeface inspired by Swiss Design, offering a clean and expressive aesthetic.

With its uniform structure and balanced spacing, Exensa Grotesk ensures excellent readability for both headlines and body text. The font family includes 5 weights (Light, Regular, Bold, Extra Bold, Black) and their italic counterparts, providing ample versatility for creative typography.

Perfect for projects requiring a modern and elegant touch, Exensa Grotesk is ideal for branding, editorial content, and digital designs. The typeface includes extended language support, 303 glyphs, and improved kerning, making it a reliable and professional choice for your next project.

Free Fonts Similar to Gotham: 

If you’re looking for a free font similar to Gotham, check out Montserrat available on Google Fonts. This is our pick for the best free Gotham alternative and it is used on featured on more than 16,000,000 websites.

20+ Fonts Similar to Gotham (2025) Summary

All in all, the best fonts similar to Gotham are all amazing finds, each designed to provide you with clean-looking and professional sans serifs for a variety of designs and projects. Whether you’re working on a client document or a creative magazine headline, we hope our roundup of the top picks in the category helps you narrow your search and makes you a more efficient storyteller.

What’s your favorite font bundle on the list? Let us know in the comment section!
